post_text:
I’m at a place 2 hours away from them and I didn’t tell them I was leaving until I was getting into my car. I also told them I was going to a different place than where I’m at. 

I can go outside whenever I want. I don’t have to walk on eggshells. I can exist. 

In the mornings I wake up peacefully and then I go for a walk along the ocean. 

I can breathe. Life is good.

edit: Ahhh thank you so much everyone for the sweet comments and the awards, I am holding space in my heart for all of you <3

Threads.Reply_Text: What if they try to visit you?

Replies.Reply_Text: Technically if you ask them to leave your property then they have to or get arrested for trespassing.
Why is everyone downvoting this question? This is a good point - you should have a plan if they somehow manage to find you.
It might have something to do with the fact that they said they didn't tell them where they were going.
No, they lied about the place. That's not the same as not telling them
Literally no difference in the impact of what happened. Why are you even having this conversation? Better still, why am I engaging with you? I have wine to enjoy...
Right? Not telling them and lying to them are different things with different outcomes. I wanted to know what OP's strategy is since I'm in a similar situation...
Sounds like they don't want that anyway, so it doesn't matter, does it?
Makes sense. OP didn't say they're going no contact so I didn't want to assume it.

Good question. If a person lives long enough at a place, a simple internet search will show the town one lives in. So it is good to be aware and have a plan to call police for trespassing, keep doors/windows locked, in case the narcissist decides to do a pop-in. Or move frequently. Not sure how celebrities keep their addresses private. It would be good to know.

This all is not said to diminish the need to celebrate OPs Freedom!!!
Congrats to OP!!! <3 Nicely done!!!
